SEARCH
Package implementazioni_postgres_dao

Class BookingDAOImpl

java.lang.Object
implementazioni_postgres_dao.BookingDAOImpl
All Implemented Interfaces:
BookingDAO
public class BookingDAOImpl extends Object implements BookingDAO
PostgreSQL implementation of the BookingDAO interface for managing booking operations in the airport management system.

This class provides concrete implementations for all booking-related database operations defined in the BookingDAO interface. It handles comprehensive booking management functions including booking creation, modification, searching, and deletion operations using PostgreSQL database connectivity.

The implementation provides comprehensive booking management capabilities including:

  • Atomic booking creation with passenger, ticket, and luggage associations
  • Complex booking modification operations with transactional integrity
  • Advanced booking search functionality with multiple filtering criteria
  • Customer-specific booking retrieval and management operations
  • Integration with flight, passenger, ticket, and luggage management systems

All database operations use prepared statements to prevent SQL injection attacks and ensure data security. The class implements proper connection management using the singleton ConnessioneDatabase pattern and handles resource cleanup through try-with-resources statements.

The class handles complex multi-table operations atomically using database transactions:

  • Booking creation involves insertions into Booking, Passenger, Ticket, and Luggage tables
  • Booking modifications use temporary tickets to maintain data consistency during updates
  • Search operations join multiple tables to provide comprehensive booking information
  • All operations maintain referential integrity through proper transaction handling

The implementation supports flexible search capabilities including flight-based filtering (departure/arrival cities, dates, times) and passenger-based filtering (names, SSN, ticket numbers). City filtering includes special handling for "Napoli" as the airport's base location.

All methods follow the contract defined by the BookingDAO interface and maintain data consistency through proper transaction handling, error logging, and validation mechanisms. The class uses soft deletion for booking cancellation to preserve audit trails and maintain referential integrity.

Since:
1.0

  • Method Details

    • addBooking

      public void addBooking(int idCustomer, String idFlight, String bookingStatus, List<String> ticketNumbers, List<Integer> seats, List<String> firstNames, List<String> lastNames, List<Date> birthDates, List<String> passengerSSNs, List<String> luggagesTypes, List<String> ticketForLuggages) throws SQLException
      Creates a new booking with associated tickets, passengers, and luggage.

      This method performs a comprehensive booking creation operation that includes inserting the booking record, creating associated passenger records (if they don't exist), generating tickets, and creating luggage associations. The operation is performed atomically to ensure data consistency.

      The method handles the complete booking workflow:

      • Creates the booking record with the specified status and customer
      • Inserts or updates passenger information as needed
      • Generates tickets with seat assignments for each passenger
      • Creates luggage records associated with specific tickets

      All list parameters must have consistent indexing where related data at the same index refers to the same passenger or ticket. The operation uses database transactions to ensure atomicity and data integrity.

      This implementation performs a comprehensive atomic booking creation operation that includes creating the booking record, managing passenger information, generating tickets with seat assignments, and creating associated luggage records.

      The operation follows this sequence:

      1. Creates the booking record with generated timestamp and specified status
      2. Retrieves the generated booking ID for subsequent operations
      3. Inserts or updates passenger information as needed
      4. Creates tickets with seat assignments for each passenger
      5. Creates luggage records associated with specific tickets

      The method uses database transactions to ensure atomicity - if any step fails, all changes are rolled back to maintain data consistency. Seat values of -1 indicate no seat assignment, while positive values are converted to 1-based database storage format.

      Passenger information is handled intelligently - if a passenger with the given SSN already exists, their information is updated; otherwise, a new passenger record is created. This allows for flexible passenger data management.

      Specified by:
      addBooking in interface BookingDAO
      Parameters:
      idCustomer - the unique identifier of the customer making the booking
      idFlight - the unique identifier of the flight being booked
      bookingStatus - the initial status of the booking (e.g., "PENDING", "CONFIRMED")
      ticketNumbers - list of unique ticket numbers for each passenger
      seats - list of seat assignments for each ticket (can contain -1 for no assignment)
      firstNames - list of passenger first names (can contain null values)
      lastNames - list of passenger last names (can contain null values)
      birthDates - list of passenger birth dates (can contain null values)
      passengerSSNs - list of passenger SSN identifiers (required, cannot be null)
      luggagesTypes - list of luggage types for each luggage item
      ticketForLuggages - list of ticket numbers associated with each luggage item
      Throws:
      SQLException - if a database access error occurs during the booking creation process

    • modifyBooking

      public void modifyBooking(String idFlight, Integer idBooking, List<String> ticketNumbers, List<Integer> seats, List<String> firstNames, List<String> lastNames, List<Date> birthDates, List<String> passengerSSNs, List<String> luggagesTypes, List<String> ticketForLuggages, String tmpTicket, String bookingStatus) throws SQLException
      Modifies an existing booking with new passenger, ticket, and luggage information.

      This method performs a complex booking modification operation that maintains data consistency through the use of temporary tickets and transactional operations. The modification process completely replaces existing tickets and luggage while preserving the original booking record.

      The operation follows this sequence:

      1. Creates a temporary ticket to maintain foreign key relationships
      2. Deletes all existing tickets except the temporary one
      3. Updates or inserts passenger information as needed
      4. Creates new tickets with updated seat assignments
      5. Creates new luggage records for the updated tickets
      6. Removes the temporary ticket
      7. Updates the booking status

      The temporary ticket mechanism ensures that the booking always has at least one associated ticket during the modification process, preventing foreign key violations and maintaining referential integrity. All operations are performed within a single transaction to ensure atomicity.

      Parameters:
      idFlight - the flight identifier for the booking
      idBooking - the unique identifier of the booking to modify
      ticketNumbers - list of new ticket numbers for the booking
      seats - list of new seat assignments (can contain -1 for no assignment)
      firstNames - list of passenger first names (can contain null values)
      lastNames - list of passenger last names (can contain null values)
      birthDates - list of passenger birth dates (can contain null values)
      passengerSSNs - list of passenger SSN identifiers (required)
      luggagesTypes - list of luggage types for new luggage items
      ticketForLuggages - list of ticket numbers associated with each luggage item
      tmpTicket - temporary ticket number used during the modification process
      bookingStatus - new status for the booking after modification
      Throws:
      SQLException - if a database access error occurs during the modification process

    • searchBooksCustomerForAFlight

      public void searchBooksCustomerForAFlight(String flightId, Integer loggedCustomerId, List<Date> bookingDates, List<String> bookingStatus, List<Integer> bookingIds) throws SQLException
      Searches for bookings made by a specific customer for a particular flight.

      This method retrieves all bookings associated with a specific customer and flight combination, providing essential booking information for customer service and booking management operations. The results are ordered by flight departure time to provide chronological organization.

      The method populates the provided lists with matching booking data including booking dates, status information, and unique booking identifiers. This information is typically used for displaying customer booking history or enabling booking modifications.

      This implementation executes a SQL query that joins the FLIGHT and BOOKING tables to retrieve bookings for a specific customer and flight combination. The results are ordered by flight departure time to provide chronological organization.

      The method populates the provided lists with booking information including:

      • Booking creation timestamps converted to Date objects
      • Current booking status values
      • Unique booking identifiers for further operations

      This method is particularly useful for customer service operations where representatives need to view all bookings a customer has made for a specific flight, enabling booking modifications and customer support functions.

      Specified by:
      searchBooksCustomerForAFlight in interface BookingDAO
      Parameters:
      flightId - the unique identifier of the flight to search for
      loggedCustomerId - the unique identifier of the customer whose bookings to retrieve
      bookingDates - list to be populated with booking creation dates
      bookingStatus - list to be populated with current booking status values
      bookingIds - list to be populated with unique booking identifiers
      Throws:
      SQLException - if a database access error occurs during the search operation

    • getAllBooksCustomer

      public void getAllBooksCustomer(Integer loggedCustomerId, List<String> flightIds, ArrayList<String> companyNames, List<Date> flightDates, List<Time> departureTimes, List<Time> arrivalTimes, List<String> flightStatus, List<Integer> maxSeats, List<Integer> freeSeats, List<String> cities, List<Boolean> types, List<Date> bookingDates, List<String> bookingStatus, List<Integer> bookingIds) throws SQLException
      Retrieves all bookings made by a specific customer across all flights.

      This method performs a comprehensive retrieval of all bookings associated with a specific customer, including complete flight information and booking details. The results provide a complete overview of the customer's travel history and current reservations for customer service and self-service applications.

      The method populates multiple lists with related data to provide complete information about each booking including flight details, timing information, and booking status. Results are ordered by flight departure time to provide chronological organization.

      This implementation executes a comprehensive SQL query that joins the FLIGHT and BOOKING tables to retrieve all bookings associated with a specific customer. The query extracts both flight details and booking information, providing a complete view of the customer's travel history.

      The method processes timestamp data by extracting both date and time components from departure and arrival timestamps, and converts booking timestamps to Date objects for consistent data handling. Results are ordered by flight departure time to provide chronological organization.

      Retrieved data includes comprehensive flight information (schedules, capacity, destinations) and booking details (status, creation time, identifiers) to support customer service and self-service booking management operations.

      Specified by:
      getAllBooksCustomer in interface BookingDAO
      Parameters:
      loggedCustomerId - the unique identifier of the customer whose bookings to retrieve
      flightIds - list to be populated with flight identifiers
      companyNames - list to be populated with airline company names
      flightDates - list to be populated with flight dates
      departureTimes - list to be populated with flight departure times
      arrivalTimes - list to be populated with flight arrival times
      flightStatus - list to be populated with current flight status values
      maxSeats - list to be populated with flight maximum seat capacity
      freeSeats - list to be populated with available seats count
      cities - list to be populated with destination or origin city names
      types - list to be populated with flight type indicators (true for arriving, false for departing)
      bookingDates - list to be populated with booking creation dates
      bookingStatus - list to be populated with current booking status values
      bookingIds - list to be populated with unique booking identifiers
      Throws:
      SQLException - if a database access error occurs during the retrieval operation

    • searchBooksCustomerFilteredFlights

      public void searchBooksCustomerFilteredFlights(String departingCity, String arrivingCity, LocalDate initialDate, LocalDate finalDate, LocalTime initialTime, LocalTime finalTime, Integer loggedCustomerId, List<String> flightIds, List<String> companyNames, List<Date> flightDates, List<Time> departureTimes, List<Time> arrivalTimes, List<String> flightStatus, List<Integer> maxSeats, List<Integer> freeSeats, List<String> cities, List<Boolean> types, List<Date> bookingDates, List<String> bookingStatus, List<Integer> bookingIds) throws SQLException
      Searches for customer bookings with flight-based filtering criteria.

      This method performs advanced booking searches based on flight characteristics such as departure/arrival cities, travel dates, and departure times. It enables customers to find their bookings using travel-related criteria rather than booking-specific information.

      The method supports flexible filtering with the following logic:

      • City filtering handles "Napoli" as the airport's base city
      • Date filtering uses inclusive ranges between initial and final dates
      • Time filtering supports both same-day and overnight time ranges
      • Results are ordered by flight departure time in descending order

      All filter parameters are optional (can be null or empty) and the method constructs appropriate SQL queries based on provided criteria.

      This implementation constructs a dynamic SQL query based on the provided flight filtering criteria. It handles special logic for "Napoli" as the airport's base city and supports flexible filtering across multiple flight characteristics.

      The filtering logic includes:

      • City filtering with special handling for "Napoli" (airport base city)
      • Date range filtering using inclusive BETWEEN operations
      • Time range filtering supporting both same-day and overnight spans
      • Dynamic query construction based on provided parameters

      Time filtering handles overnight time ranges by using OR logic when the initial time is after the final time, searching for flights departing after the initial time OR before the final time.

      Results are ordered by flight departure time in descending order to show the most recent bookings first, which is typically most relevant for customer service and booking management operations.

      Specified by:
      searchBooksCustomerFilteredFlights in interface BookingDAO
      Parameters:
      departingCity - the departure city name for filtering (can be null or empty)
      arrivingCity - the arrival city name for filtering (can be null or empty)
      initialDate - the start date for date range filtering (can be null)
      finalDate - the end date for date range filtering (can be null)
      initialTime - the start time for time range filtering (can be null)
      finalTime - the end time for time range filtering (can be null)
      loggedCustomerId - the unique identifier of the customer whose bookings to search
      flightIds - list to be populated with matching flight identifiers
      companyNames - list to be populated with airline company names
      flightDates - list to be populated with flight dates
      departureTimes - list to be populated with flight departure times
      arrivalTimes - list to be populated with flight arrival times
      flightStatus - list to be populated with current flight status values
      maxSeats - list to be populated with flight maximum seat capacity
      freeSeats - list to be populated with available seats count
      cities - list to be populated with destination or origin city names
      types - list to be populated with flight type indicators (true for departing, false for arriving)
      bookingDates - list to be populated with booking creation dates
      bookingStatus - list to be populated with current booking status values
      bookingIds - list to be populated with unique booking identifiers
      Throws:
      SQLException - if a database access error occurs during the search operation

    • searchBooksCustomerFilteredPassengers

      public void searchBooksCustomerFilteredPassengers(String firstName, String lastName, String passengerSSN, String ticketNumber, Integer loggedCustomerId, List<String> flightIds, List<String> companyNames, List<Date> flightDates, List<Time> departureTimes, List<Time> arrivalTimes, List<String> flightStatus, List<Integer> maxSeats, List<Integer> freeSeats, List<String> cities, List<Boolean> types, List<Date> bookingDates, List<String> bookingStatus, List<Integer> bookingIds) throws SQLException
      Searches for customer bookings with passenger-based filtering criteria.

      This method performs advanced booking searches based on passenger information such as names, SSN, or ticket numbers. It enables customers and customer service representatives to find bookings using passenger-specific information when flight details are not readily available.

      The method supports flexible passenger-based filtering including:

      • First name matching with case-insensitive partial matching
      • Last name matching with case-insensitive partial matching
      • SSN matching with case-insensitive partial matching
      • Ticket number matching with case-insensitive partial matching

      All filter parameters are optional and use SQL ILIKE for flexible matching. The method returns distinct results to avoid duplicates when multiple passengers in the same booking match the criteria. Results are ordered by flight departure time in descending order.

      This implementation constructs a complex SQL query that joins FLIGHT, BOOKING, TICKET, and PASSENGER tables to enable searching based on passenger information. It uses DISTINCT to avoid duplicate results when multiple passengers in the same booking match the search criteria.

      The search supports flexible filtering with the following criteria:

      • First name matching with case-insensitive partial matching (ILIKE)
      • Last name matching with case-insensitive partial matching (ILIKE)
      • SSN matching with case-insensitive partial matching (ILIKE)
      • Ticket number matching with case-insensitive partial matching (ILIKE)

      All filter parameters are optional and use SQL ILIKE for flexible matching. The method returns distinct results to avoid duplicates when multiple passengers in the same booking match the criteria. Results are ordered by flight departure time in descending order to show the most recent bookings first.

      This search method is particularly useful for customer service operations where representatives need to find bookings based on passenger information rather than flight details, enabling support for customers who may not remember exact flight information but can provide passenger details.

      Specified by:
      searchBooksCustomerFilteredPassengers in interface BookingDAO
      Parameters:
      firstName - the passenger first name for filtering (can be null or empty)
      lastName - the passenger last name for filtering (can be null or empty)
      passengerSSN - the passenger SSN for filtering (can be null or empty)
      ticketNumber - the ticket number for filtering (can be null or empty)
      loggedCustomerId - the unique identifier of the customer whose bookings to search
      flightIds - list to be populated with matching flight identifiers
      companyNames - list to be populated with airline company names
      flightDates - list to be populated with flight dates
      departureTimes - list to be populated with flight departure times
      arrivalTimes - list to be populated with flight arrival times
      flightStatus - list to be populated with current flight status values
      maxSeats - list to be populated with flight maximum seat capacity
      freeSeats - list to be populated with available seats count
      cities - list to be populated with destination or origin city names
      types - list to be populated with flight type indicators
      bookingDates - list to be populated with booking creation dates
      bookingStatus - list to be populated with current booking status values
      bookingIds - list to be populated with unique booking identifiers
      Throws:
      SQLException - if a database access error occurs during the search operation

    • deleteBooking

      public void deleteBooking(int bookingId) throws SQLException
      Performs a soft deletion of a booking by changing its status to 'CANCELLED'.

      This method implements soft deletion by updating the booking status rather than physically removing the booking record from the database. This approach preserves data integrity and maintains audit trails for administrative and compliance purposes while effectively removing the booking from active operations.

      The soft deletion process:

      • Updates the booking_status to 'CANCELLED' for the specified booking
      • Preserves all booking data for audit and historical purposes
      • Maintains referential integrity with related tickets, passengers, and luggage
      • Allows the booking to be excluded from active booking queries when needed

      Cancelled bookings are typically filtered out of customer-facing queries but remain accessible for administrative reporting and audit purposes. This approach ensures compliance with data retention requirements while providing clear booking lifecycle management.

      Parameters:
      bookingId - the unique identifier of the booking to delete/cancel
      Throws:
      SQLException - if a database access error occurs during the deletion operation
